courses.name: Computer Science and Information Systems

assessments.title: A brief online quiz course expectations, policies, and grading, meant to ensure all students understand how the course will run
assessments.description: A brief online quiz covering course expectations, policies, and grading, meant to ensure all students understand how the course will run.

assessments.title: This in-class quiz will cover programming fundamentals, with a focus on variables, data types, and basic operations
assessments.description: This in-class quiz will cover programming fundamentals, with a focus on variables, data types, and basic operations.

assessments.title: An in-class quiz testing your understanding of if-statements, loops, and how to control program flow
assessments.description: An in-class quiz testing your understanding of if-statements, loops, and how to control program flow.

assessments.title: Your first assignment involves writing a Python script to solve a set of simple math problems. Submit your code through the course portal
assessments.description: Your first assignment involves writing a Python script to solve a set of simple math problems. Submit your code through the course portal.

assessments.title: You'll develop a simple calculator app using Python functions and user input. The assignment emphasizes code structure and user experience
assessments.description: You'll develop a simple calculator app using Python functions and user input. The assignment emphasizes code structure and user experience.

assessments.title: This assignment asks you to read and write data from files using Python, practicing essential skills for handling input and output
assessments.description: This assignment asks you to read and write data from files using Python, practicing essential skills for handling input and output.

assessments.title: Build a simple game in Python using functions, logic, and user input. This assignment focuses on creativity and code organization
assessments.description: Build a simple game in Python using functions, logic, and user input. This assignment focuses on creativity and code organization.

assessments.title: Submit a short write-up (1-2 pages) proposing your idea for the final group project, your team members and project goals
assessments.description: Submit a short write-up (1-2 pages) proposing your idea for the final group project, including your team members and project goals.

otherInfo: Participation is worth 10% and is based on regular attendance, in-class engagement, and contributions to group activities.  The Group Project (12%) is a group assignment due December 3, 2025.  Students should bring a non-programmable calculator and their cheat sheet to Midterm 1.
